definition: long-winded/wordy/troublesome/pesky/also pr. [luo1 suo1]
(final exclamatory particle)
see 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
suck
long-winded/verbose

sentences.english: You lean, haggard, please allow me a million times care and long winded.
sentences.chinese: 你瘦了，憔悴了，请允许我千万次的关心和啰嗦。

sentences.english: Verily, this vichyssoise of verbiage veers most verbose .
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，我这啰嗦的解释最终变得冗长无比。

sentences.english: By now all of you should have noticed how long-winded I am.
sentences.chinese: 现在你们都知道了，我是个有点啰嗦的人。

sentences.english: Don’t let other people’s ramblings control your day.
sentences.chinese: 别让他人的啰啰嗦嗦控制了你的生活。

sentences.english: Without sounding too repetitive, focus is the reason for success or failure.
sentences.chinese: 别嫌啰嗦，力量的集中程度是成败的原因所在。

sentences.english: And I hate being the bitchy , naggy mom.
sentences.chinese: 我不想做一个讨人厌的啰嗦母亲。

sentences.english: This writer has the fault at excess wordage.
sentences.chinese: 这个作家有过分啰嗦的缺点。

sentences.english: Code in XAML and C# is really verbose.
sentences.chinese: 用XAML和C#编写的代码非常啰嗦。

sentences.english: I cannot finish your verbose report.
sentences.chinese: 你的报告冗长啰嗦，我无法读毕。

sentences.english: She droned on for hours about the uses of the present tense.
sentences.chinese: 她花了好几个小时啰嗦现在时的用法。

sentences.english: The instructor canceled most of verbose expressions in his composition.
sentences.chinese: 老师把他的作文里重复啰嗦的成分都划掉了。

sentences.english: I have emphasized the importance of individual difference so wordily .
sentences.chinese: 我想我已经对个体差异在管理中的重要性啰嗦够了。

sentences.english: In New Testament times, prayers were wordy, meaningless rituals.
sentences.chinese: 在新约时代，很多祷告就是一些啰嗦，没意义的形式。

definition: incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
long-winded/verbose
nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
to prattle/to chatter away/to nag/garrulous/nagging
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to chatter/to babble
to be chattersome/to talk on and on without stopping/to nag
to chatter/to hog the conversation
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
(dialect) to dawdle/to waste time/also written 墨跡|墨迹[mo4 ji5]
effeminate/old-womanish/garrulous/fainthearted/overly careful/overly sensitive/maudlin
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
a bunch of nonsense/verbose and rambling
talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly
